Thank you for this rare title! I am old enough to have seen this film in 70 mm super widescreen in a movie theatre, with 6-track stereo sound. It's a pity it now only be found on vhs fullscreen with mono. The only interest for people today would be to see if it really was "as bad as they say".

As a Norwegian, I must admit that I am ashamed of this movie, and we can only blame American director Andrew L. Stone for having so little reverence for our beloved composer. The real Edvard Grieg was only 1.52 meters (5 feet) tall. He had to sit on a book to reach the piano, and his back was deformed from tuberculosis. So he was hardly material for the hero of a musical, dancing up and down mountains and walls!
